column4: if ubuntu has a driver for it that isn't working, you'd need to blacklist it before using ndiswrapper

i simply want to manually mount the windows drive
you'll see the current entry for the fat32 partition just change the path there
if you want to manually mount it you can use Disks
just make the folder first
if you can't create a folder in /media then hit Alt+F2 then type in gksudo nautilus

How do i access Ubuntu's (on HDD) FileSystem from a Ubuntu LIve CD?
so wait
lemme get you more instructions first
assume liveCD is running and Ubuntu FS (the one on HDD) is on hda1
cancel out the CTRL+ALT+F7 part
then you're gonna type in             sudo apt-get install nvidia-glx
next you'll type in            sudo nvidia-glx-config enable
How do i access Ubuntu's (on HDD) FileSystem from a Ubuntu LIve CD?
assume liveCD is running and Ubuntu FS (the one on HDD) is on hda1
and at this point you should be able to hit CTRL+ALT+F7 and get graphical interface back up with the new drivers
once you are at this point you should be able to install like normal... though I'd appreciate it if you start up GAIM and come tell us if it worked before starting the install.
